* Erfarenhet från managementverktyg såsom Grafana eller liknande ses som meriterande
* Certifiering inom Aruba, Cisco och/eller Fortinet ses som starkt meriterande
* Flytande svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift.


**Varför Telia Cygate?**
 På Telia Cygate är vi inte bara experter på nätverk, säkerhet och olika slags moln – vi är också ett gäng som tycker att det ska vara kul att gå till jobbet! Som en del av Telia Company har vi styrkan att skapa verklig påverkan i stor skala, bidra till samhällsnytta och hjälpa våra kunder att navigera i digitaliseringens värld. Vi gör det alltid med värme, omtanke och ett leende. Här är det idéerna och våra olika perspektiv som gör oss starka, och tillsammans ser vi till att teknikens värld blir en plats där alla trivs – och där du hör hemma.
   

  

 Hos oss är din utveckling viktig. Vi uppmuntrar till kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och ser till att just du och dina intressen är i fokus. Vi vet att det är människorna som utgör vårt företag, och därför värdesätter vi glädje, kreativitet och olika perspektiv i allt vi gör.
   

  

 Välkommen att växa tillsammans med oss, där vi gör teknik mänsklig och skapar verklig påverkan!
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 Ta chansen och bli en del av vårt härliga team! Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig. Sista ansökningsdag är
 **2025-10-12**
 Placeringsort: Stockholm med möjlighet till hybridarbete
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta mig gärna, Solveig Jagelid på solveig.jagelid@cygate.se eller via LinkedIn.
   

  

 Bakgrundskontroll är en del i våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

**Välkommen till Telia Cygate – Home of Experts**

title: Lösningsarkitekt
description:
*Att välja Capgemini innebär att välja ett företag där du får möjlighet att forma din karriär på det sätt du önskar. Här kommer att få stöd och inspiration inom en samarbetsvillig gemenskap med kollegor både lokalt och runt om i världen, som ständigt omdefinierar vad som är möjligt. Du kommer att vara en del av området Cloud and Custom Application (C&CA) på Capgemini. Här kommer du att arbeta med de senaste teknologierna inom Cloud, Integration, AI och mjukvaruutveckling. Vi utvecklar skräddarsydda applikationer och hanterar komplexa integrationer för att maximera teknikens potential. Följ med oss och samarbeta med världens ledande organisationer för att realisera teknikens fulla värde genom innovativa lösningar*
**Om rollen**
 Som lösningsarkitekt har du en bred teknisk bakgrund samtidigt som du förstår verksamhetens behov och utmaningar och kan omsätta dessa till funktionella och icke-funktionella krav. Du kan hantera och mitigera risker, samla intressenter, har goda ledaregenskaper och är en duktig kommunikatör.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du in tidigt in i projekten med uppgiften att förstå verksamhetens mål och behov för att omsätta detta till den lösningsarkitektur som ger mest värde till verksamheten. Du arbetar i tät samverkan med både expertkollegor från Capgemini och kunden, tillsammans med utvecklingsteam, produktägare och kundens övriga intressenter.
   

  

 Vår starka position på marknaden med kunder som är Sveriges största och mest välkända både inom den publika och privata sektorn har gett oss möjligheten till omfattande och spännande åtaganden inom digital transformation. Det utmanar oss att ständigt utvecklas.
   

  

 Vi arbetar professionellt och metodiskt i en lärande miljö och både din teamchef och ditt kompetensteam stöttar dig och din utveckling som konsult. Vi träffas ofta för att utbyta erfarenheter, lära oss nya saker i en bransch som ständigt förändras – och inte minst för att ha kul tillsammans!
   

  

**Din profil**
* Flera års erfarenhet som lösningsarkitekt
* Bakgrund inom systemutveckling, och vana av att leda andra
* Erfarenhet av arbete med etablerade metodiker och ramverk för arkitektur och agil systemutveckling.
* Högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande
* Goda kunskaper i såväl svenska som engelska


**… och erfarenhet eller intresse av:**
* Konsultrollen samt av arbete med beslutsfattare
* Att verka utifrån kundens perspektiv och förmåga att analysera och utforma arkitektur och systemlösningar baserat på verksamhetens krav, processer och informationsbehov
* Molnbaserade lösningar, AI, säkerhet, processautomatisering eller integration
* Arbete som lösningsarkitekt i komplexa miljöer
* Certifierad IT-arkitekt


**Vad vi tror kommer att få dig att trivas**
* En positiv arbetsmiljö med starkt fokus på innovation och kompetens. Du kommer att arbeta med många av de senaste tekniktrenderna och vara omgiven av duktiga kollegor.
* På Capgemini blir du en del av en global organisation med starkt kundfokus, samarbetskultur och möjlighet till kontinuerligt lärande och utveckling.
* Vårt Digital Architecture-team i Stockholm består av ca 20 kollegor som arbetar som Enterprise-, Verksamhets- och lösningsarkitekter hos våra kunder.
* Capgemini har varit en dominerande aktör inom arkitekturområdet sedan 90-talet, med vårt eget ramverk Integrated Architecture Framework (IAF) och vi bidrar även aktivt till vidareutvecklingen av TOGAF.
* Vi har ett aktivt, globalt arkitektforum med lokala undergrupper där du kan dra nytta av globala och lokala experter inom arkitektur och även bidra med din egen erfarenhet.
* Våra värderingar: Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Freedom, Team spirit, Modesty and Fun


**Ansökan**
* Vi arbetar med löpande urval så vänta inte - skicka in din ansökan redan idag. Vi ser framemot din ansökan och att du vill bli en del av vår fortsatta resa!
* Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kommer identitetskontroll att genomföras genom granskning av ditt ID-kort, och bakgrundskontroller kan utföras vid behov.


**Om Capgemini**
 Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda övergången till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, generativ AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2024 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Co-founder AI Engineer
description:
I'm helping a stellar team find a co-founder - if you're a top technical talent, reach out!
 



  





 --
 



 We're looking for a co-founder to take lead on AI and backend. We're as of now a two person team: a full stack design engineer who sketches in Figma for breakfast and ships code for dinner, and a commercial and product focused startup operator who's scaled startups from zero to multi million businesses before.
 



  





**The problem we're tackling:** 




 • Huge inefficiencies causing $B worth of financial damage each year
 



 • All macro trends currently pointing towards a world where the problem gets worse
 



 • It's not easy to solve
 



  





**What you'll do:** 




 • Own all things AI - model selection, tuning, architecture, retrieval pipeline, source integrations etc.
 



 • Build out other parts of backend
 



 • Have fun while doing it :)
 



  





**If below resonates, you'll fit well:** 




 • Believes accountability and ownership is non-negotiable
 



 • Values clear and candid communication and feedback
 



 • Thrives in uncertainty and making order out of chaos
 



 • Wants to build, and has an urgency to do so - both a world class product, and a world class team
 



 • Thinks that the highest performing teams consists of exceptionally smart and egoless people
 



  





**What the opportunity is:** 




 • A full Co-founder role with commensurate equity, responsibility and expectations on them
 



  





**What the opportunity isn't:** 




 • A part-time opportunity
 



 • Risk free
 



  





 Send us an email at hi@havna.io if the above sounds interesting. We would love to learn more about you!

title: AI Product Director, LearnWith.AI (Remote) - $400,000/year USD
job_function: Engineering, Information Technology, and Product Management
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
Are you a product leader ready to use AI to transform how education works? We're looking for someone to lead our Education vertical and own the mission of helping students learn more effectively. This role is about driving systemic change, not just delivering incremental features.
   

  

 This role is defined by owning a strategic outcome, not managing the process. You will be responsible for defining an objective for our Education vertical and be empowered to achieve it. You will personally author the master "Brain Lift" that codifies our strategy and defines the portfolio roadmap that makes all our educational products work as one. You'll lead a team of sharp Product Owners, operating as a player-coach who remains deep in the most critical work.
   

  

 The standard one-size-fits-all education model fails to serve the individual student. Our approach is to build a new system from a foundation of learning science and AI to deliver truly individualized instruction. We are proving that education can be both deeply personal and highly impactful.
   

  

 This role is different from a typical VP of Product position. If you prefer managing process over owning outcomes, or want to delegate core strategic work, this is not the right fit. We're looking for a leader who is deeply analytical, a clear first-principles thinker, and relentless in achieving the stated goal.
   

  

 You will lead a sharp team of product owners and work directly with the founders to steer the entire vertical. The measure of your success is simple: clear, data-backed proof that your strategy measurably improved how students learn. If you're ready for a challenge of this scope and accountability, let's talk.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Architecting the Domain Knowledge: Own and evolve the master "Education Domain BrainLift," synthesizing team and market insights into a single, cohesive strategy that aligns the entire vertical on key product decisions.
* Driving the Portfolio Roadmap: Translate the Domain BrainLift into an outcome-driven roadmap for the whole product portfolio. You will define the sequence of work that creates compounding value and provides the strategic "why" to direct your team's execution.
* Player-Coach Execution: Act as a player-coach: drive your own OODA loops on critical outcomes to set the standard, while mentoring your team by reviewing their iterations and sharpening their insights for cohesive portfolio execution.


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Acting as a pure people manager. Your primary role is to lead the vertical's strategy and set the standard for execution, not just manage headcount, budgets, and process.
* Executing a top-down strategy that has been handed to you. You are expected to personally author the cohesive, overarching strategy for the entire vertical, synthesizing insights from the ground up.
* Creating static, long-term roadmaps. Your portfolio roadmap is a living document. You will steer the portfolio with agility, drawing on weekly learnings from your team's iterations and your own.
* Overseeing a "feature factory." Your success is defined by achieving the strategic outcome for the vertical. This requires creating true cross-pollination between products, not just shipping more features in silos.


**Basic Requirements**
**AI Product Director key responsibilities**
* At least 6 years of experience in a product leadership role where you personally shaped the product vision and owned the core problem-solution hypothesis
* Previous experience launching at least one successful product (not just a feature or a module) that reached real users (not internal tools) from scratch (not joining partway through the development process) to launch (achieving at least $1 million in revenue)
* Professional experience using AI in your daily work (e.g., research, analysis, synthesis, strategy)


**About LearnWith.AI**
 LearnWith.AI is an edtech startup that leverages AI and subject matter experts to cultivate a new way of learning. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and AI-powered coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn more, learn faster, and learn better - and have fun while doing it. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with us**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover as a Contractor of Record. The compensation level for this role is $200 USD/hour, which equates to $400,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

 Crossover Job Code: LJ-5660-SE-Stockhol-AIProductDirec.001

title: AI-Driven Data & Analytics Expert: Advising Technical Professional Clients (Director/Analyst, Fully Remote: Ireland/UK/Netherlands/Denmark/Spain/Sweden)
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Research Services
description:
About the role:
   

  

 Gartner Analysts are industry thought leaders who create must-have research, market predictions and best practices for a broad range of world-leading organizations. The Analyst is a leader within Gartner’s Business & Technology Insights practice, and has a credible voice within their designated industry. An Analyst produces pragmatic and provocative research which Gartner clients apply to propel their business toward key objectives. They are a trusted source of advice for clients, reinforcing Gartner’s value every day by engaging them to solve complex business challenges.
   

  

 This Analyst will be a member of a team that provides technical analysis and implementation advice to Gartner client companies for AI-Powered Data Analytics topics within Gartner’s IT Role Based Products practice in the Gartner Business and Technology Insights organization.
   

  

 What you will do:
   

  

* Create innovative and thought provoking technical analysis and best practice implementation content for the Gartner for Technical Professionals product offering. (Clients are Data Analytics Architects/Engineers and similar roles in large, global companies in Europe/UK)
* Deliver high-impact content for and engage with Gartner clients on insights and best practices for evolving data and analytics environments to prepare for AI/GenAI technologies, including many topics such as:
+ Agentic Analytics, AI-Powered Analytics, Decision Intelligence, Graph Analytics, LLMs, RAG, Agentic AI, Analytics Engineering, and AI Data Engineering

* Develop new research and ideas through thought leadership and offer compelling, actionable approaches to client's needs and requests that accelerate the client's ability to act.
* Develop in-depth technical analysis and implementation guidance to identify the root cause of business challenges and reframe thinking to drive strategy forward.
* Demonstrate thought leadership across a team of analysts.
* Bring provocative, independent insights to Gartner leaders that can evolve the course of a research agenda.
* Provide clients and prospects with actionable advice aligned to their designated content area via virtual or face-to-face interactions, with the ability to effectively engage and interact with a broad range of client roles from technical architects to leaders to CIOs.
* Create and deliver high value presentation materials on and off stage for Gartner events, industry and professional association conferences, and client briefings.
* Provide sales support serving as voice of the market to help research teams create content and to drive engagement with clients to make progress against their critical priorities to grow their business.
* Provide high quality and timely research content peer review.
* Build credibility as an industry expert to represent Gartner research, methodology and strategy.
* Actively participate in innovation, ideation, and research discussions and collaborate effectively with peers in the research community.
* Identify research process improvements or develop new processes that help the team provide excellent service delivery.
* Be a mentor and a coach by supporting more junior team members.
* Be client-centric while actively seeking to help clients engage regularly and often with Gartner research and interactions.


 What you will need:
   

  

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
* 10+ years of relevant field or industry experience
* Demonstrated executive presence; can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders
* Strong organizational skills; ability to work under tight deadlines and produce high quality deliverables
* Demonstrated research and writing ability
* Strong written and verbal proficiency, analytical and presentation skills; ability to engage clients and respond effectively to questions
* Proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data; ability apply frameworks and create/ defend conclusions to client challenges
* Strong communication skills, ability to explain complex concepts concisely and simply
* Subject matter expert comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements
* Ability to work independently, while also being intrinsically motivated to collaborate across teams and support the workflow of others, in a multicultural global team
* Learning agility and the ability to adapt in highly matrixed environments
* Ability to represent Gartner's research methodology and strategies effectively at all levels


**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:102420
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy

title: Säkerhetstekniker till anstalterna Täby och Österåker
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen**
 Kriminalvården växer – vi bygger nytt, bygger om och bygger till och söker nu fler medarbetare. Vårt viktigaste mål är att minska återfall i brott – att bryta den onda cirkeln. Lyckas vi med det blir samhället tryggare och säkrare för alla. Vi är den myndighet som ansvarar för anstalter, frivård, häkten och klienttransporter.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer? Hör vad våra medarbetare tycker om att arbeta inom Kriminalvården: https://www.kriminalvarden.se/jobba-hos-oss/
   

  

 Verksamhetsområde Stockholm Öst omfattar de slutna anstalterna Täby och Österåker. Den största yrkesgruppen är kriminalvårdare men här arbetar även vårdpersonal, administrativ personal, lärare, produktionsledare m fl. De intagna är sysselsatta med utbildning, behandlingsprogram, verkstadsproduktion, monterings- och förpackningsarbete och annan strukturerad verksamhet. Anstalten Täby nås med buss, tåg eller bil. Anstalten Österåker ligger utanför Åkersberga och nås med bil eller buss. Åker du bil parkerar du på anstalternas personalparkeringar. Anstalten Österåker är inne i en expansiv utbyggnadsfas och bygger nya bostadshus med anstaltsplatser och tillhörande lokaler för sysselsättning för successiv driftsättning 2025-2027.
   

  

 Läs mer om anstalten Täbys verksamhet här: https://www.kriminalvarden.se/kontakt/hitta-och-kontakta/verksamhet/anstalt/taby/#verksamhet
   

  

 Läs mer om anstalten Österåkers verksamhet här: https://www.kriminalvarden.se/hitta-och-kontakta/verksamhet/anstalt/osteraker/#om
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som säkerhetstekniker på verksamhetsområde Stockholm Öst kommer du att arbeta med högteknologiska säkerhetssystem som ligger i framkant avseende nätverksansluten utrustning. Säkerhetssystemen kommer att bestå bl.a. av överordnat larmsystem, samtalsanläggning, överfallslarmsystem, CCTV/kamerasystem, bildlagringsservrar, olika typer av larm- och passersystem samt intern- och externt telefonisystem.
   

  

 Du är verksamhetsområdets främsta kompetens inom säkerhetsteknik vilket bl.a. innebär att du ansvarar för underhåll och support (installationer, uppgraderingar och service etc.) av alla säkerhetssystem. I arbetet ingår även att tillsammans med din chef ansvara för att infrastrukturen för säkerhetssystemen är i linje med Kriminalvårdens behov. Du planerar och ansvarar för kravspecifikationer och beställningar av säkerhetssystem samt ser till att större arbeten genomförs av leverantörer. Du agerar teknisk support och stödjer samtliga avdelningar med säkerhetstekniska frågor inom området. Du informerar, utbildar och handleder personal i handhavande av säkerhetsanordningar samt vara lås- och nyckelansvarig. Dina arbetsuppgifter sträcker sig över hela anstaltsområdet, även i klientmiljö.
   

  

 På verksamhetsområdet finns det idag en säkerhetstekniker som du kommer dela arbetsuppgifterna med. Du kommer även att samarbeta och utbyta erfarenheter i vardagen med säkerhetstekniker vid andra anstalter och häkten. Tjänstgöring kommer ske på både anstalten Täby och anstalten Österåker.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Som säkerhetstekniker ser vi att du har god samarbetsförmåga och hög grad av servicekänsla. Vidare ser vi att du har en god förmåga att självständigt planera, organisera och anpassa ditt arbete samt att slutföra arbetsuppgifterna i tid. Då ditt arbete är en nödvändig funktion för driften av verksamheten är det viktigt att du är flexibel och lyhörd för behov som uppkommer.
   

  

 Du har i grunden ett genuint intresse för säkerhetsteknik och säkerhetsarbete men för att trivas och lyckas i ditt uppdrag är det också viktigt att du delar Kriminalvårdens grundläggande värderingar om en human människosyn, respekt för individen och tron på att människan är utvecklingsbar. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Gymnasieskolekompetens och gärna med inriktning på teknik/el/IT eller annan utbildning inom säkerhetsteknik som Kriminalvården bedömer likvärdig.
* Erfarenhet som tekniker med övergripande larmsystem såsom överordnade system, CCTV-system, passagesystem, praktisk eller annan erfarenhet som Kriminalvården bedömer likvärdig.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Svenskt medborgarskap.
* B-körkort


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom teknik/el/säkerhet.
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom Kriminalvårdens tekniska system.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med egenkontroller.
* Erfarenhet av IT-nätverksdragning.
* Erfarenhet av nyckel- och låshantering.


**Övrig information**
 För att bli aktuell för anställning inom Kriminalvården krävs att du motsvarar högt ställda krav gällande lämplighet, omdöme, säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetande och att du följer gällande lagar. Det innebär att du står upp för demokratiska värderingar och den statliga värdegrund som gäller för Kriminalvårdens verksamhet.
   

  

 Vissa befattningar är placerade i säkerhetsklass och då kommer en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. För vissa säkerhetsklassade tjänster krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Kriminalvården välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Läs mer om säkerhetsprövningen på: https://www.kriminalvarden.se/jobba-hos-oss/rekryteringsprocessen/sakerhetsprovning-vid-rekrytering/
   

  

 Befattningen kan innebära krigsplacering vid Kriminalvården. Läs mer om krigsplacering på: https://www.kriminalvarden.se/jobba-hos-oss/rekryteringsprocessen/krigsplacering/
   

  

 Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas.
   

  

 Kriminalvården strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ökad mångfald.
   

  

 För att skicka in din ansökan, klicka på ansökningslänken i annonsen. Frågor om hur du ansöker och lägger in ditt CV ställer du direkt till Visma Recruit. Frågor om specifika jobb besvaras av den kontaktperson som anges i annonsen.
   

  

 Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av rekryteringsannonser. Kriminalvården har upphandlade avtal.

title: Product Development Leader
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


Are you a recent graduate eager to build a rewarding career in technology and product development? Join us and embark on a journey to become a Product Development Leader at Ericsson!

  

We are building a brand-new unit in Karlskrona, and this is a unique opportunity to join from the ground up.

  

In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to develop the skills needed to secure technology leadership by delivering products with the right scope, quality, timing, and cost — all while supporting lean and agile ways of working. You will learn to teach, coach, and inspire teams, helping individuals and organizations grow and foster a culture of innovation and continuous learning.


As you gain experience, you can progress into leadership roles such as R&D line manager, program manager, project manager, coach, or change leader, where you will play a key part in executing development strategies and driving success.


Start your career with us and grow into a role that shapes the future of technology!

 **Who are we?**


At Ericsson, our vision is to create a world where limitless connectivity enhances lives, transforms businesses, and leads the way to a sustainable future. Our office is in the charming world heritage town of Karlskrona, nestled in a stunning archipelago.


Join us and seize the opportunity to collaborate with passionate colleagues who are at the forefront of cutting-edge technologies. We foster a strong culture of knowledge sharing and ensure that work is always enjoyable. Experience the global environment as we closely collaborate and cooperate with colleagues across various Ericsson locations.  

  

**What will you do?**

  

You will drive your career and personal development by engaging in a variety of assignments within the Karlskrona R&D Center’s strategic competence areas—Cloud Native, Fintech, AI Native, DevOps, Security, and Autonomous Network. These opportunities will allow you to strengthen your technological leadership skills and continuously enhance your capabilities as a future leader.


For example, you may take on roles such as Project Manager for software development or improvement initiatives. The exact scope of your assignments will be determined collaboratively between you and us, ensuring flexibility to align with your strengths and our evolving organizational needs.

**To be successful in the role we believe you need:**
-----------------------------------------------------


**Technical Expertise & Business Acumen**

  

* Relevant academic background, such as MSc in Industrial Economics and Management, or equivalent.
* Technical leadership capabilities, with business and data analytics experience
* AI-first mindset to leverage artificial intelligence in daily work for innovative outcomes.
* Experience with Agile methodologies, risk management, and assessing technical complexity.
* Previous experience at Ericsson is a plus.

 **Mindset & Personal Qualities**

  

* Demonstrated positive, creative, and proactive attitude with a strong eagerness to learn and grow alongside your team.
* Proactive problem-solver committed to continuous improvement and driving results.
* Strong sense of accountability, reliability, transparency, and honesty.
* Resilient in challenging situations, with a commitment to inclusivity and respect for diverse perspectives.

 **Collaboration & Leadership**

  

* Excellent collaboration skills, thriving in diverse and inclusive environments.
* Skilled in motivating, engaging, and mentoring team members to achieve shared goals.
* Adept at resolving conflicts, listening actively, empathizing, and providing constructive feedback.

 **Communication & Language Skills**

  

* Strong communication abilities to clearly convey instructions, deliver quality outcomes, and request support when needed.
* Proficiency in English, both written and spoken.

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you’re stepping into an exciting world full of possibilities! It’s your chance to unleash your creativity and skills to break new ground and solve some of the toughest challenges out there. You’ll be challenged, but never on your own. Join a vibrant, diverse team of innovators who are passionate about pushing past the ordinary to create the future. Plus, you’ll get to work alongside talented software developers who share your love for coding and building amazing things!

  

We offer the possibility to have a high growth in your software developer and being challenged in different roles. If you want to grow together with us, apply!  

**Please note: That due to GDPR we don't accept application via email.**

title: Backend Engineer - Orders Team
description:
**About The Role**
 The Orders team plays an integral role in our organization. Working in this core team means you’ll have a significant impact on the entire company and the opportunity to collaborate closely with other teams. Together, we continue to develop one of Sweden’s most widely used delivery services - and you could play a key role in shaping the future of delivery!
   

  

**Some of the things you will do**
* Build the next generation of our crucial order handling system.
* Collaborate closely with product teams and engage with stakeholders to better understand user needs, providing valuable input to improve our product.
* Drive innovation and develop future-proof solutions that align with company goals.
* Stay curious and up-to-date with relevant technologies, and assess how they can enhance our systems and workflows.
* Review and analyze our current systems to identify opportunities for improvement and increased efficiency.


**Your future team**
 The Orders team is responsible for developing and maintaining the backbone of our business: order handling. This involves everything from creating and managing orders to ensuring their successful completion and everything in between. By doing so, you will empower and support all other development teams, helping them deliver their best work.
   

  

 The team is currently made up of two experienced engineers, with the support of an Engineering Manager, a Product Manager, and a Staff Engineer. We work with a high level of autonomy, giving you the opportunity to have a real impact on the solutions and decisions foundational to Instabee's success.
   

  

 Collaboration is key to our success. We embrace pair- and mob programming along with code reviews to foster teamwork, knowledge sharing, and to tackle complex problems together.
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
* Experience as a Backend Engineer in a modern tech environment
* Experience with Node.js, do you also know Java it’s a bonus
* MongoDB experience (or equivalent database technologies)
* Proficiency with Kubernetes
* Familiarity with GCP
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
* Innovation and learning ability


 If this is you then we can’t wait to meet you!
   

  

**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

* 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
* 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
* 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
* 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care and love to your little one.
* 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!m for your leisure time.
* ⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.


 Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
   

  

**Get to know us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee in Sweden.*
*Employment for this role will be with Instabox Group AB.*

title: Backend Engineer (Go) - Matchmaking
description:
As a Backend Engineer at Embark you will be an integral part of a highly creative game team focused on building powerful and reusable infrastructure and backend components for our games.
   

  

 Here you will have the opportunity to take initiative and drive finding solutions to exciting challenges, building the services that power our games, making sure they scale and continuously improve on them.
   

  

 As our game is distributed between game client, game server and the cloud, you’ll work together with your team to figure out which parts of the problem to solve in which location. At Embark we believe in creating smaller teams of well-aligned experts that can be trusted to create games and keep them running.
   

  

 You will be working mainly on matchmaking, but also, data analytic, game client, backend service infrastructures, etc. Some of the technologies we use to make all of those are Go, C++, GCP, Bazel, Kubernetes, Grafana, Google Spanner.
   

  

 You do not need to have any experience from games or games studios to apply.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Collaborate and work closely with fellow software engineers and technical stakeholders
* Build and improve services, features and tools for game development
* Continuously improve our engineering practices
* Make sure your code adds a great amount of value to your colleagues


**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind
* A passion for interactive experiences, games and new technologies
* A solid understanding of building and maintaining complex distributed systems with performance, optimization, and observability in mind
* Comfortable working across domains—backend services, data analytic, game clients, infrastructure and observability
* Comfortable with Go and modern backend tech
* The ability to be a great team player with good communication skills
* Interest in taking initiatives and driving finding solutions to exciting challenges
* Professional English communication skills


**Additionally, we think it would be a great bonus if you are**
* Familiar with Site Reliability Engineering practices and what it takes to keep services running smoothly around the clock


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Head of Contracting Nordics
description:
**Who are WebBeds?**



WebBeds is the fastest growing and most significant accommodation supplier to the travel industry. We are a global company offering ground services (hotels, transfers, tours, activities) to travel professionals. Our products help our partners and customers to create amazing Travel experiences.



Our Products range from a Retail Online platform, Integration Connectivity hub and distribution APIs to name but a few and our systems are 100% cloud hosted processing up to 5.0bn search requests daily. We deliver amazing outcomes using leading edge technology through innovative and creative thinking.



WebBeds is a subsidiary of Web Travel Group (ASX: WEB) – an ASX 200 listed company operating a global digital travel business.

 **What makes us stand out?**


* We are a wholesale global travel organization
* We have 1500+ people speaking 50+ languages in 120+ cites across 50+ countries
* We partner with over 430,000 properties in more than 15,000 destinations
* We work with more than 44,000 travel companies in 139 source markets
* We have an amazing Technology team focused on delivering valuable outcomes using innovative tech and creative & lateral thinking

 **What will you do on your journey with WebBeds?**



WebBeds is the world’s fastest growing provider of accommodation distribution services to the travel industry. Our products incorporate distribution APIs, payment integrations, ERP integration, Data Lakes, User Interfaces, and others. Our search API reach peaks of more than 50.000 requests per second, each one consisting of tens or hundreds of hotels, with continued expansion.



"We design, deliver and support innovative solutions through engagement, collaboration and a fearsome passion for creating customer value" is our mission as an IT organization.



With this in mind, we strive to be at the leading edge of technology when it comes to build the platform that meets the needs of our Supply partners and customers. This translates to the use of latest technology including .NET Core versions, K8S, microservices architecture, clouds hosting and orchestration, CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, Proactive monitoring, and alerting systems, to name a few.



Our delivery teams have the creativity and freedom to express themselves by building innovative solutions to often complex problems and are challenged to reach higher levels daily. Our teams consist of product owners, QA engineers, Software Engineers, and people from across the business all working collectively and collaboratively. We have a very strong technical team from which you will be able to learn but are encouraged by new ideas and fresh thinking that you will bring with you.

 **In this Role you will:**



Lead the day-to-day operations of the Nordic contracting team, overseeing both individual performance and team-wide delivery. You’ll coach and support Contract Managers, set performance targets, and foster a culture of collaboration and growth. Simultaneously, you will manage a personal portfolio of hotel partnerships, negotiating contracts and securing competitive terms. You will build and maintain strong relationships with hotel chains, monitor regional trends, and proactively respond to market needs. Acting as a strategic link between internal stakeholders and external suppliers, you’ll ensure high product quality, optimize supplier performance, and contribute directly to WebBeds’ commercial objectives.

  

**Key Responsibilities**


* Lead and manage the regional team to ensure all members meet their KPIs and objectives. Support performance through regular monitoring, open feedback, and by fostering a culture of innovation and proactivity.
Conduct regular one-to-one meetings to maintain strong two-way communication:  
* 

- With team members: Review performance, align on short-, medium-, and long-term goals, conduct pre- and post-business trip briefings, and take corrective actions as needed to maximise results.


* With the Vice President of Northern Europe: Share updates on individual and team performance, discuss trading improvements, flag challenges, and collaborate on solutions. Seek guidance when necessary.


* Support recruitment activities within the department as required.
* Set high standards and enhance the team’s commercial capability. Identify development needs and support individual growth through coaching, mentoring, and training. Accompany team members on business trips where appropriate to provide in-the-field support.
* Ensure the team is fully familiar with key procurement tools and requirements relevant to the region, including connectivity and channel manager usage.
* Empower the team to manage and strengthen commercial relationships with hotel partners, including key regional chains, working closely with internal stakeholders such as Reservations, Sales, Revenue, and Accounts.
* Promote strong internal communication by sharing successful contracting initiatives and flagging any destination-related issues with relevant departments in a timely manner.
* Deliver against annual departmental and individual KPIs and objectives.
* Negotiate and secure competitive contracts that meet company requirements for rates, allocations, overrides, and other key commercial terms within your assigned area.
* Regularly analyse production data to ensure sufficient inventory aligned with destination performance targets.
* Optimise contract performance by securing tactical promotions and special offers to drive competitiveness and sales.
* Ensure timely re-contracting of existing hotels in line with agreed renewal cycles and business timelines.
* Identify and prioritise contracting of ‘must-have’ hotels to enhance regional portfolio strength.
* Lead strategic negotiations and partnership management with key hotel chains to maximise market share and long-term collaboration.
* Plan and carry out in-year contracting trips to secure renewals and sign new properties, aligned with personal and team targets.
* Negotiate added-value offers and exclusive deals to support revenue growth and distribution advantage.
* Monitor competitor pricing and availability, responding to market demand and trends proactively.
* Proactively address supplier-related service level issues, ensuring high standards of delivery.
* Conduct regular hotel inspections and ensure up-to-date, accurate product content (e.g., amenities, photos, facilities).
* Share relevant destination intelligence internally, including peak travel dates, local events, and trade shows.
* Take responsibility for mitigating commercial losses through proactive negotiation and issue resolution.
* Identify underperforming hotels and implement actions to improve or replace them as appropriate.

  



**The skills we would love to see in your suitcase!**


* Minimum 5 years’ experience in hotel contracting and team management.
* Proven track record in hotel partnerships and commercial performance within the Nordics market.
* Demonstrated experience in managing relationships with major hotel chains in the region.
* Strong negotiation and relationship-building skills.
* Proactive leadership style with the ability to develop and motivate teams.
* High attention to detail and accuracy.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English; fluency in one or more Nordic languages is an advantage.
* Comfortable working under pressure and focused on achieving results.
* Solid working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
* Confident team leadership and delegation.
* Target-driven mindset.
* Strong internal and external communication.
* Effective stakeholder management.
* Willingness to travel within the region.

 **Why choose us as your next destination?**



We are super proud of our dedicated team of friendly, energetic & passionate professionals. Our people are key to the success of our business & everybody at WebBeds has their own unique role to play as we continue to drive the company forward.



Over 50 different languages are spoken by our workforce, but whether working from offices in Dubai or London or out in the field in Johannesburg or Buenos Aires, we all share the common goal to take pride in what we do & to deliver our partners with unbeatable service & support.


International highly skilled group of experts from all around the globe
Dynamic environment with the chance to grow, influence & impact change
Disruptive, fast-growing market leader within travel & endless possibilities
Culture built on collaboration empowerment and innovation
  

Find out more about the WebBeds business at www.webbeds.com - **#LI-Hybrid**

title: Consultant, Technology Enabled Transformation
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Research Services
description:
**About the role:**
 Gartner’s Consulting business is an
 ***extension***
 of Gartner’s industry-leading IT Research. From CIOs, to leaders in business and government, we help Gartner clients across enterprises translate insights into transformational actions and achieve their mission-critical priorities. Leveraging the breadth of Gartner’s resources, Consulting is growing rapidly, with unlimited potential to continue expanding our client base.
   

  

 Technology Strategy Consulting. We help the C-suite make the right decisions based on how technology can transform their businesses. In today’s world, a consulting firm that is “born digital”, (with the ability to directly leverage the full power of Gartner’s research and insights) has relevance to the most important strategic decisions any business will make.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Consultant working at the highest senior levels within our clients’ organizations you will have the opportunity to make a real difference in shaping, managing and delivering real value assisting our clients in successfully managing their technology and defining their IT strategies.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Identify, develop and document issues and recommendations using independent judgment concerning engagement areas being reviewed.
* Conduct research, interviews and presentations for clients (executive and/or board level)
* Assist with the comprehensive cost / benefits analysis and preparation of business cases for technology investments.
* Assist in coordinating and communicating the results of engagements via written reports and oral presentations to client management and key stakeholders
* Contribute to the development of project management, quality assurance and professional consulting and auditing approaches/methodologies.
* Participate in delivery of strategic IT consulting engagements, within a given timeframe and budget, for a variety of clients, which include IT benchmarking and general IT consulting.


**What you’ll need:**
* Diversified strategic IT experience (technology, organization and processes).
* A strong skillset in Architecture or Cloud or Infrastructure or Application development or AI.
* Consulting experience in a similar role in a professional services firm or industry. experience at a strategic or management level.
* Analytical skills.
* Flexibility and adaptability; able to change direction quickly and thoughtfully under changing client needs.
* Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree.
* Excellent project management skills, team work capacity, strong work ethic and willingness to travel and work in a diverse international environment.
* Fluent in Swedish language.
* Swedish security clearable.


**Who you are:**
* Excellent presentation and communication skills, both written and spoken
* Ability to articulate IT strategies and understand business strategies
* Comfortable influencing and building trust-based, value-added relationships with senior executives
* Coachable and embracing of best practices and feedback as a means of continuous improvement
* Consistently high achiever marked by perseverance, humility and a positive outlook in the face of challenges
* Maintain a senior consultant level expertise and currency in industry leading information management technologies
* You will have a natural aptitude for critical and analytical thinking, as well as the capacity to accept out-of-the box solutions


**Our Team Culture**
 At Gartner Consulting Nordics, we believe that great work starts with great people. You’ll be part of a team that is anchored in shared values, deep technology expertise, and a strong sense of purpose. We foster a culture of trust, collaboration, and continuous learning—where every voice is valued and every contribution matters.
   

  

 We also believe in flexibility. Our consultants enjoy the freedom to work from wherever they perform best—whether that’s from home, the office, or on-site with clients. What unites us is not where we work, but how we work: with integrity, curiosity, and a commitment to making a difference.
   

  

**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:100549
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
